programmes.show_description: 2001. Adventure. Adapted by Adrian Hodges. Stars Bob Hoskins, James Fox & Elaine Cassidy. Part 1. An expedition leaves for the jungle where a man battles with dinosaurs and primitive ancestors.
2001. Adventure. Adapted by Adrian Hodges. Stars Bob Hoskins, James Fox & Elaine Cassidy. Part 2. An expedition leaves for the jungle where a man battles with dinosaurs and primitive ancestors.
John J Diggs. Stars Rhonda Fleming & Jack Kruschen. John J. Diggs appears to be scrounging from tourists in a Mexican town. But Margo Haley thinks there's more to him than that.
Appleby Fair/Ramming Time. 1986. The annual Romany horse fair in the Eden Valley and a sheep farm in the South Downs are the subjects of two more films from Jack's country diary.
1939. Western. Director: Raymond K. Johnson. Stars: Fred Scott, Jean Carmen, John Merton. The Colonel sends Fred Dawson and Doc Flanders to investigate a cattleman war.
Early silent animation made in 1935, charming hand drawn cartoon and story.
The Wedding. 1974. Stars Brian Coburn, Pearl Hackney & Nigel Havers. Lord William forbids his niece from marrying after accusing her of hiding Black Arrow, however her nurse has other plans.
1997. Stars Brendan Pollecutt, Fezile Mpela & Robert Finlayson. The two boys manage to escape the crash but back at base camp it is realised that the relics have been stolen.
Theft of Excalibur. 1956. Stars William Russell, Cyril Smith & Ronald Leigh-Hunt. A knight is held to ransom. The price for his release is King Arthur's sword, Excalibur.
Flop Goes the Joker. 1967. Stars Adam, West Burt Ward & Alan Napier. The Joker makes his move against the Gotham City Museum for a grand extortion scheme.
Strangers. 1954. Stars Roy Rogers, Trigger & Dale Evans. A group of outlaws on the run pretend to be surveyors. Unknowing Lanny Gaines lets the group stay with him and his ailing father.
The Mysterons. 1967. Stars Sylvia Anderson, Ed Bishop & Cy Grant. After a misunderstanding on the planet Mars, a war is started between humans and an alien race called The Mysterons.
The Bride. 1958. Stars: Conrad Phillips, Willoughby Goddard & Jennifer Jayne. Maddelenna is being forcibly taken to Altdorf Castle as a bride for Gessler.
Dan Tempest and the Amazons. 1956. Stars Robert Shaw, Joan Sims & Neil Hallett. A French pirate arrives in New Providence and attempts to sell seven women.
The Inquisitor. 1956. Stars Richard Greene, Victor Woolf & Archie Duncan. A visiting archbishop questions Friar Tuck following his capture. Robin and Little John work out how to rescue him.
1954. Sci-fi Mystery. Directed by W. Lee Wilder. Stars Peter Graves, James Seay & Steve Pendleton. An atomic scientist injured in a plane crash makes a claim that he was abducted by aliens.
1957. Action. Directed by Jack Lee. Stars Peter Finch, Ronald Lewis and Maureen Swanson. Two brothers join their father in Captain Starlight's (Finch) bushranger gang in 19th century Australia.
The Big Fish. 1958. Stars Robert Beatty, John Howlett & Richard Bebb. The success of a rank outsider at a race meeting nets certain people a small fortune to suspicion.
Episode in Bathurst. 1961. Stars Peter Graves, Chuck Faulkner & Joe McCormick. Cobb's stages are halted outside Bathurst until he agrees to pay toll to gunmen who have taken over the town.

programmes.show_name: The Sea Shall Not Have Them
programmes.show_description: 1954. War. Directed by Lewis Gilbert. Stars Michael Redgrave, Dirk Bogarde & Bonar Colleano. In 1944, passengers of a downed aircraft discuss their lives while awaiting rescue from the North Sea.
1960. Evidence in Concrete. Directed by Gordon Hales. Starring Russell Napier, Howard Pays and Peter Welch. A young girl's body found near a busy motorway tells of something sinister. (S1, E34)
Death in Mind. 1962. Stars Rupert Davies, Neville Jason & Anton Rodgers. A rich old woman and her maid have been murdered. Maigret allows the prime suspect to escape custody to learn the truth.
2002. Drama. Director: David Attwood. Stars Richard Roxburgh, Ian Hart & Richard E. Grant. Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate after being told an heir's estate is plagued by a ghostly dog.
1970. Horror. Director: Andy Milligan. Stars Gavin Reed, Jackie Skarvellis & Berwick Kaler. A family of vampires are searching for new blood since a inbreeding is destroying the family line...
1984. Stars. An entertaining short film about two women who are hitch-hiking with little to no luck until a kind truck driver helps them. The ride does not turn out to be as simple as it seemed.
1994. Hosted by Antoine de Caunes and Jean Paul Gaultier. Kylie Minogue is interviewed by Jean Paul. We are joined by some of Kylie Minogue's biggests fans in Dublin, three drag queens.
1978. Two dumb aliens are sent to earth to find an earthwoman suitable to be the wife of their leader. Stars Cameron Mitchell.
1971. Comedy. Director: Bob Kellett. Stars: Frankie Howerd, Eartha Kitt, Anna Quayle, Roy Hudd. Lurkalot is a serf who sells chastity belts and love potions at the local market place.

programmes.show_name: Look At Life Stuck on Stamps
programmes.show_description: 1968. An incredible look at stamps in Britain from their design to their issue.
The Roman Wall. 1956. Stars William Russell, Cyril Smith & Ronald Leigh-Hunt. King Boltoan tells Lancelot and Brian that his daughter has been abducted by ghostly warriors dressed as Romans.
Raptures of the Deep. 1964. Stars Ray Barrett, Robert Easton & Gary Miller. While the Stingray crew go to the rescue of two crazy treasure hunters, Troy falls down a crevasse and runs out of air.
1965. The Swinging Mrs Jones. Classic crime series produced by Aaron Spelling and starring Anne Francis. Honey poses as a society matron in an effort to smash a blackmailing ring.
1939. Action. Directors: John English & William Witney. Stars Ralph Byrd, Irving Pichel & Ted Pearson. A mad doctor uses a drug to bring himself back from the dead after his execution in prison.
1953. Sci-fi. Directed by Terence Fisher. Stars Howard Duff, Eva Bartok & Alan Wheatley. When a test launch of a satellite fails, two people attached to the secret project mysteriously go missing.
1937. Adventure. Director: Edward A. Kull & Wilbur McGaugh. Stars Bruce Bennett, Ula Holt & Frank Baker. Tarzan, Martling and Ula retrieve a Mayan idol, leading them into chaos in the jungle!
Lafe Lingers On. 1964. Stars Donna Douglas, Peter Whitney & Max Baer Jr. Lafe Crick returns to the Clampett mansion with another scheme to try to get rich off of Jed's money.
1962. Fantasy. Directed by Nathan Juran. Stars Kerwin Mathews, Judi Meredith, & Torin Thatcher. The treacherous Pendragon plots to gain the throne of Cornwall. Can anyone stop the evil sorcerer?
King Tut's Coup. 1967. Stars Adam West, Burt Ward & Alan Napier. An Egyptology professor believes he is King Tut and kidnaps Lisa. Batman and Robin track him down but end up in troubled waters!
1948. Drama. Directed by Arthur Crabtree. Stars Greta Gynt, John McCallum & Raymond Lovell. A racehorse owner becomes involved in a scandal after losing his money and his fianc√©e.
1985. The classic game show Give us a Clue hosted by Michael Parkinson, this week's guests are Lynda Bellingham, Robin Cousins, Tim Flavin, Bonnie Langford, Paul Nicholas and Marti Webb.
The Finny Foot Affair. 1964. Stars Robert Vaughn, David McCallum, Kurt Russell & Leo G. Carroll. Solo is trying to track down a chemical agent that hastens the aging process.
Happy St David's Day! Enjoy the brilliant Llantrisant Choir, then Mike & Noel have a great short film full of footballers in 1945 as well as a wonderful Scopitone of Gary Lewis & The Playboys!
Death with Due Notice. 1988. Stars Robert Powell, Christopher Scoular & Gavin Richards. A quiet break in the country turns into a weekend of murder when Hannay is targeted by a killer.
Is It Catching? 1981. Stars Mollie Sugden, Christopher Blake & Jennifer Lonsdale. Ida agrees to look after her brother's grandchild, but she has no idea what she is letting herself in for.
The Broken Link. Stars Ron Randell, Peter Neil & Philip Friend. Two business partners receive a letter from a client threatening prosecution. To avoid prison they come up with a plan to murder.
The Case of the Medicine Man. 1964. Stars John Barrie, William Gaunt, John Richmond & Peter Sallis. A priest known as 'Brother Edward' is beaten up and Reverend Wales thinks Edward is in danger...
1972. With Freddie Starr and Peter Goodwright, guest acts such as Joe Baker, Margo Henderson, Clive Lea and Jenny Maynard play a number of roles in a series of sketches and songs!
1975. Comedy. Director: Norman Cohen. Stars Robin Askwith, Anthony Booth & Bill Maynard. The adventures of accident-prone, amorously inclined Timmy Lea, as he tries to achieve pop music stardom.
1979. Sci-fi. Director: Gary Nelson. Stars Maximilian Schell, Anthony Perkins, Robert Forster. Space explorers delve into a mystery after finding a long-lost spaceship at the edge of a black hole.
